article_title: Undocumented could be allowed to buy Covered California health policy
article_text:
00:59 Lock it up: Medicine safety in your home Pause

01:11 Brain-dead Vacaville toddler leaves U.S. for treatment, attorney says

02:07 Mother of toddler declared brain dead: 'I know you're going to come out of this'

00:46 "Knitted Knockers" help women with breast cancer

01:07 Music used to de-stress and calm dementia patients

01:17 Stebbins Cold Canyon Nature Reserve reopens after fire

00:43 Parents of brain dead toddler fight to keep him on life support in Roseville

01:36 California's aid-in-dying law helps one woman reclaim a 'measure of control'

01:09 Health startup incubator challenges, supports Sacramento innovators

01:04 Mentorship conference pushes black students into medical careers

article_metadata.description: In a move called both symbolic and practical, the Covered California board took the first step Thursday toward allowing undocumented residents to purchase health plans – with no state or federal subsidies – through California’s Obamacare marketplace.
article_metadata.title: Undocumented could be allowed to buy Covered California health policy | The Sacramento Bee
